channel.title: Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory on UCSD CCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory on UCSD CCAL

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: CTD2
item.description: The CTD2 Center at the University of California San Diego (UCSD) aims to identify oncogenic cell states and characterize the most salient genomic and immune hallmarks to infer optimal combinations of pharmacologic and immunological perturbagens. Learn More

item.title: Contact Us

item.title: Publications
item.description: 2019 2018 2017 2016 Older 2019 Cancer Research 10 July 2019 Metformin inhibits progression of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma by acting Directly on Carcinoma Initiating Cells Xingyu Wu, Huwate Yeerna, Yusuke Goto, Toshinori Ando, Victoria H Wu, Xuefeng Zhang, Zhiyong Wang, Panomwat Amornphimoltham, Anne N. Murphy, Pablo Tamayo, Qianming Chen, Scott M. Lippman and J. Silvio Gutkind Journal of Biological Chemistry 5 June 2019

item.title: Resources
item.description: Explore Cellular Contexts Get CCAL Codebase Setup Computational Environment Workflows These workflows are used and updated regularly by the CCAL team. Please use Github Issues for questions or problems that arise when running them. Works in Progress Model and Infer Select features most useful for data decomposition, decompose data into NMF factors, define data states, annotate data states and factors, and visualize annotated factors and states on a map.

item.title: Team
item.description: Team Members Pablo Tamayo Director UCSD Center for Cancer Target Discovery and Development (CTD2) Group Leader, Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory (CCAL) Co-Director, Genomics and Computational Biology Shared Resource (GCBSR) Professor, Division of Medical Genetics, UC San Diego School of Medicine Visiting Scientist, Cancer Program, Broad Institute of MIT/Harvard William J. Kim Co-Director, UCSD Center for Cancer Target Discovery and Development (CTD2) Assistant Professor, Division of Medical Genetics, UC San Diego School of Medicine Visiting Scientist, Cancer Program, Broad Institute of MIT/Harvard Benjamin Briggs Hematology Oncology Fellow Rady Institute for Genomic Medicine Elizabeth Brunk Cancer Therapeutics Postdoctoral Fellow Xiaojun Max Xu Research Data Scientist Computational Oncologist Alex Wenzel Graduate Student Mesirov Lab Adam Officer Graduate Student Emily Addleson Experimental Biologist Kim Lab Stephanie Ting Research Data Scientist I Mustafa Khan Software Engineer Andrew M.
